title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement cnxifeng9819@163.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Xifeng Zhang. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Zhang X (2024). MNormTest: Multivariate Normal Hypothesis Testing. R package version 1.1.0, https://astringency.github.io/MNormTest/, https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=MNormTest, https://github.com/Astringency/MNormTest.
code: @Manual{,   title = {MNormTest: Multivariate Normal Hypothesis Testing},   author = {Xifeng Zhang},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.1.0, https://astringency.github.io/MNormTest/, https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=MNormTest},   url = {https://github.com/Astringency/MNormTest}, }

title: Multivariate Normal Hypothesis Testing
text: Please note MNormTest project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Multivariate Normal Hypothesis Testing
text: MNormTest包的目标是提供一套用于多元正态分布参数假设检验的函数，包括检验单个均值向量、两个均值向量、多个均值向量、单个协方差矩阵、多个协方差矩阵、同时检验均值和协方差矩阵，以及检验多元正态随机向量的独立性. objective MNormTest provide set functions hypothesis testing parameters multivariate normal distributions, including testing single mean vector, two mean vectors, multiple mean vectors, single covariance matrix, multiple covariance matrices, mean covariance matrix simultaneously, testing independence multivariate normal random vectors.

title: Multivariate Normal Hypothesis Testing
text: CRAN: 首先，您可以从CRAN安装MNormTest的发布版本: Firstly, can install released version MNormTest CRAN : GitHub: 其次，您可以从GitHub安装MNormTest的开发版本: ’s , can install development version MNormTest GitHub :
code: install.packages("MNormTest") install.packages("pak") pak::pak("Astringency/MNormTest")

title: Multivariate Normal Hypothesis Testing
text: 在使用MNormTest包之前，您需要先加载它: using MNormTest, need load :
code: library(MNormTest)

title: Multivariate Normal Hypothesis Testing
text: MNormTest提供了7个函数： MNormTest provides 7 functions: meanTest.single, meanTest.two, meanTest.multi, covTest.single, covTest.multi, meancov.Test, ind.Test.multi.

what: 均值向量检验 (Mean Vector Test)
title: Multivariate Normal Hypothesis Testing
text: meanTest.single被用于单个多元正态总体（总体协方差阵已知和未知时）的均值向量的检验.详细内容可参照函数的说明文档. meanTest.single used testing mean vector single multivariate normal population (population covariance matrix known unknown). details, please refer documentation function. meanTest.two被用于两个多元正态总体（总体协方差阵未知相等或不等）的均值向量的检验. 在总体协方差阵不相等时，函数提供了两种处理方法将其化为单样本问题：构造配对数据（两样本量相同）Coupled和构造修正后的数据（两样本量不同）Tranformed，详细内容可参照函数的说明文档. meanTest.two used testing mean vectors two multivariate normal populations (population covariance matrices unknown equal unequal). population covariance matrices unequal, function provides two methods reduce single sample problem: constructing paired data (two samples size) Coupled constructing transformed data (two samples different sizes) Tranformed. details, please refer documentation function. meanTest.multi被用于多个多元正态总体（总体协方差阵已知且相等）的均值向量的检验，采用Wilks Λ\Lambda统计量进行检验. 但由于分布的特殊性，函数提供了两种近方法（Bartlett’s χ2\chi^2和Rao’s FF）的检验结果，并给出了Wilks Λ\Lambda统计量的实现值及其自由度（需指定full = TRUE），若您想进行精确检验，则请根据统计量的实现值和自由度自行查找临界值. 详细内容可参照函数的说明文档. meanTest.multi used testing mean vectors multiple multivariate normal populations (population covariance matrices known equal), using Wilks Λ\Lambda statistic testing. However, due special distribution, function provides test results two approximate methods (Bartlett’s χ2\chi^2 Rao’s FF) gives observed value degrees freedom Wilks Λ\Lambda statistic (need specify full = TRUE), want conduct exact test, please find critical value according observed value degrees freedom statistic. details, please refer documentation function.
code: ?meanTest.single # or ??meanTest.single ?meanTest.two # or ??meanTest.two ?meanTest.multi # or ??meanTest.multi

what: 协方差矩阵检验 (Covariance Matrix Test)
title: Multivariate Normal Hypothesis Testing
text: covTest.single被用于单个多元正态总体（总体均值未知时）的协方差矩阵的检验. 包含了2种情况： covTest.single used testing covariance matrix single multivariate normal population (population mean unknown). function contains two cases: H0:Σ=Σ0,H1:Σ≠Σ0(Σ0 known) H_0: \Sigma = \Sigma_0, \quad H_1: \Sigma \neq \Sigma_0 (\Sigma_0 \text{ known}) H0:Σ=σ2Σ0,H1:Σ≠σ2Σ0(σ2 unknown,Σ0 known) H_0: \Sigma = \sigma^2 \Sigma_0, \quad H_1: \Sigma \neq \sigma^2 \Sigma_0 (\sigma^2 \text{ unknown}, \Sigma_0 \text{ known}) 在第二种情况中，若Σ0=\Sigma_0 = ，则检验通常称为球形检验. 您可以通过设置不同的函数参数来选择检验的类型，详细内容可参照函数的说明文档. second case, Σ0=\Sigma_0 = , test usually called sphericity test. can choose type test setting different parameters function. details, please refer documentation function. covTest.multi被用于多个多元正态总体（总体均值未知时）的协方差矩阵的检验. 详细内容可参照函数的说明文档. covTest.multi used testing covariance matrices multiple multivariate normal populations (population mean unknown). details, please refer documentation function.
code: ?covTest.single # or ??covTest.single ?covTest.multi # or ??covTest.multi

id: 均值和协方差矩阵的同时检验-mean-and-covariance-matrix-test
what: 均值和协方差矩阵的同时检验 (Mean and Covariance Matrix Test)
title: Multivariate Normal Hypothesis Testing
text: meancov.Test被用于多个多元正态总体的均值和协方差矩阵的同时检验. 详细内容可参照函数的说明文档. meancov.Test used testing mean covariance matrices multiple multivariate normal populations simultaneously. details, please refer documentation function.
code: ?meancov.Test # or ??meancov.Test

id: 多元正态随机向量的独立性检验-independence-test-of-multivariate-normal-random-vectors
what: 多元正态随机向量的独立性检验 (Independence Test of Multivariate Normal Random Vectors)
title: Multivariate Normal Hypothesis Testing
text: ind.Test.multi被用于多元正态随机向量的独立性检验. 详细内容可参照函数的说明文档. ind.Test.multi used testing independence multivariate normal random vectors. details, please refer documentation function.
code: ?ind.Test.multi # or ??ind.Test.multi

title: Multivariate Normal Hypothesis Testing
text: 下面是几个简单的例子，展示了如何使用MNormTest包进行多元正态分布参数的假设检验，我们使用著名的鸢尾花数据集iris进行多总体协方阵的检验. 更多示例可以参考每个函数的说明文档. simple examples show use MNormTest test parameters multivariate normal distributions. use famous iris dataset iris test covariance matrices multiple populations. examples can found documentation function. 我们首先来看一下数据集iris的前几行: First, let’s take look first rows dataset iris: 该数据集包含了150个样品，每个样品包含5个变量：4个特征（Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, Petal.Length, Petal.Width）和1个类别（Species）.为了方便后面的检验，我们将二者分开: dataset contains 150 samples, sample contains 5 variables: 4 features (Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, Petal.Length, Petal.Width) 1 category (Species). convenience following tests, separate : 鸢尾花的类别有三种：setosa, versicolor, virginica. 这便是我们的三个总体（这里假设三个总体均服从四元正态分布），我们现在想要检验它们的协方差矩阵是否相等. 检验假设如下： three categories iris: setosa, versicolor, virginica. three populations (assuming three populations follow four-dimensional normal distribution), now want test whether covariance matrices equal. hypotheses follows: H0:Σ1=Σ2=Σ3,H1:Σi equal H_0: \Sigma_1 = \Sigma_2 = \Sigma_3, \quad H_1: \text{} \Sigma_i \text{ equal} 给定显著性水平α=0.05\alpha = 0.05，我们可以使用covTest.multi进行检验： Given significance level α=0.05\alpha = 0.05, can use covTest.multi testing: 若仅需要得到检验结论，可用如下代码： need test results, can use following code: 若需要输出全部结果，记得设置full = TRUE. need output results, remember set full = TRUE. 计算得χ2\chi^2统计量为140.94，p=0.0000<0.05=αp = 0.0000 < 0.05 = \alpha（pp值很小，在R的运算中直接算成0了），故拒绝原假设，认为在显著性水平α=0.05\alpha = 0.05下，三种鸢尾花的协方差矩阵不相等. calculated χ2\chi^2 statistic 140.94, p=0.0000<0.05=αp = 0.0000 < 0.05 = \alpha (pp small, directly calculated 0 R), reject null hypothesis conclude covariance matrices three categories iris equal significance level α=0.05\alpha = 0.05.
code: data(iris) head(iris) chart <- iris[, 1:4] species <- iris[, 5] covTest.multi(chart, species) covTest.multi(chart, species, full = TRUE)

what: Test of Mean and Covariance Matrix at the Same Time — meancov.Test
title: Test of Mean and Covariance Matrix at the Same Time — meancov.Test
text: Hypothesis testing multiple multivariate normal population mean vectors covariance matrices (Test simultaneously).

title: Test of Mean and Covariance Matrix at the Same Time — meancov.Test
code: meancov.Test(X, label, alpha = 0.05, detail = TRUE)

title: Test of Mean and Covariance Matrix at the Same Time — meancov.Test
text: X data matrix matrix data frame. label vector group labels. alpha significance level. Default 0.05. detail boolean value. Default TRUE. TRUE, detail test result displayed.

title: Test of Mean and Covariance Matrix at the Same Time — meancov.Test
text: full FALSE, list containing hypothesis, statistics conclusion returned. full TRUE, list containing hypothesis, sample size, total sample mean, within group mean, total sum squares, within sum squares, statistics, modify factor, df Chi2, p value, critical value conclusion returned.

title: Test of Mean and Covariance Matrix at the Same Time — meancov.Test
text: Huixuan, Gao. Applied Multivariate Statistical Analysis. Peking University Press, 2005: pp.90-91.

title: Test of Mean and Covariance Matrix at the Same Time — meancov.Test
text: Xifeng Zhang

title: Test of Mean and Covariance Matrix at the Same Time — meancov.Test
code: data(iris) chart <- iris[, 1:4] species <- iris[, 5] meancov.Test(chart, species) #> $Hypothesis #> [1] "H0: mu1 = mu2 = ... = muk, Sigma1 = Sigma2 = ... = Sigmak, k =  3" #>  #> $`Sample Size` #>     setosa versicolor  virginica  #>         50         50         50  #>  #> $`Total Sample Mean` #> Sepal.Length  Sepal.Width Petal.Length  Petal.Width  #>     5.843333     3.057333     3.758000     1.199333  #>  #> $`Within Group Mean` #> $`Within Group Mean`$setosa #> Sepal.Length  Sepal.Width Petal.Length  Petal.Width  #>        5.006        3.428        1.462        0.246  #>  #> $`Within Group Mean`$versicolor #> Sepal.Length  Sepal.Width Petal.Length  Petal.Width  #>        5.936        2.770        4.260        1.326  #>  #> $`Within Group Mean`$virginica #> Sepal.Length  Sepal.Width Petal.Length  Petal.Width  #>        6.588        2.974        5.552        2.026  #>  #>  #> $`Total Sum of Squares` #>              Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width #> Sepal.Length   102.168333   -6.322667     189.8730    76.92433 #> Sepal.Width     -6.322667   28.306933     -49.1188   -18.12427 #> Petal.Length   189.873000  -49.118800     464.3254   193.04580 #> Petal.Width     76.924333  -18.124267     193.0458    86.56993 #>  #> $`Within Sum of Squares` #>              Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width #> Sepal.Length      38.9562     13.6300      24.6246      5.6450 #> Sepal.Width       13.6300     16.9620       8.1208      4.8084 #> Petal.Length      24.6246      8.1208      27.2226      6.2718 #> Petal.Width        5.6450      4.8084       6.2718      6.1566 #>  #> $Statistics #>                    Statistics         Value p.value Critical.Value #> 1            Likelihood Ratio 1.767862e-155      NA             NA #> 2 Likelihood Ratio (Modified) 2.200389e-152      NA             NA #> 3                           M  6.984086e+02      NA             NA #> 4                        Chi2  6.809880e+02       0       41.33714 #>  #> $`Modify Factor` #> [1] 0.02494331 #>  #> $`Degree of freedom` #> [1] "Chi2( 28 )" #>  #> $Conclusion #> [1] "Reject" #>  meancov.Test(chart, species, full = TRUE) #> Error in meancov.Test(chart, species, full = TRUE): unused argument (full = TRUE)

what: Test of Multiple Covariance Matrix — covTest.multi
title: Test of Multiple Covariance Matrix — covTest.multi
text: Hypothesis testing multiple multivariate normal population covariance matrices population mean unknown.

title: Test of Multiple Covariance Matrix — covTest.multi
code: covTest.multi(X, label, alpha = 0.05, detail = TRUE)

title: Test of Multiple Covariance Matrix — covTest.multi
text: X data matrix matrix data frame. label vector group labels. alpha significance level. Default 0.05. detail boolean value. Default TRUE. TRUE, detail test result displayed.

title: Test of Multiple Covariance Matrix — covTest.multi
text: full FALSE, list containing hypothesis, statistics conclusion returned. full TRUE, list containing hypothesis, sample size, total sample mean, within group mean, within group sample covariance, total sum squares, within sum squares, statistics, modify factor, degree freedom, p value, critical value conclusion returned.

title: Test of Multiple Covariance Matrix — covTest.multi
text: Huixuan, Gao. Applied Multivariate Statistical Analysis. Peking University Press, 2005: pp.88-89.

title: Test of Multiple Covariance Matrix — covTest.multi
text: Xifeng Zhang

what: Test of Single Covariance Matrix — covTest.single
title: Test of Single Covariance Matrix — covTest.single
text: Hypothesis testing covariance matrices single normal population mean vector unknown.

title: Test of Single Covariance Matrix — covTest.single
code: covTest.single(data, Sigma0, ball = FALSE, alpha = 0.05, detail = TRUE)

title: Test of Single Covariance Matrix — covTest.single
text: data data matrix matrix data frame. Sigma0 covariance matrix null hypothesis true. ball boolean value. Default FALSE. FALSE, covariance matrix Sigma0 (known). TRUE Sigma0 unit matrix, Mauchly's ball test performed. TRUE Sigma0 unit matrix, covariance array tested see sigma^2*Sigma0 (sigma^2 unknown). alpha significance level. Default 0.05. detail boolean value. Default TRUE. TRUE, detail test result displayed.

title: Test of Single Covariance Matrix — covTest.single
text: list containing hypothesis, sample mean, sample deviation, statistics, degree freedom, p value, critical value conclusion returned.

title: Test of Single Covariance Matrix — covTest.single
text: Huixuan, Gao. Applied Multivariate Statistical Analysis. Peking University Press, 2005: pp.83-88.

title: Test of Single Covariance Matrix — covTest.single
text: Xifeng Zhang

title: Test of Single Covariance Matrix — covTest.single
code: data(iris) X <- iris[, 1:4] covTest.single(X, diag(1, 4)) #> $Hypothesis #> [1] "H0: Sigma = Sigma0" #>  #> $`Sample Mean` #> Sepal.Length  Sepal.Width Petal.Length  Petal.Width  #>       5.8433       3.0573       3.7580       1.1993  #>  #> $`Sample deviation` #>              Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width #> Sepal.Length   102.168333   -6.322667     189.8730    76.92433 #> Sepal.Width     -6.322667   28.306933     -49.1188   -18.12427 #> Petal.Length   189.873000  -49.118800     464.3254   193.04580 #> Petal.Width     76.924333  -18.124267     193.0458    86.56993 #>  #> $Statistics #>         Statistics         Value p.value Critical.Value #> 1 Likelihood Ratio 3.829315e-223      NA             NA #> 2             Chi2  1.024268e+03       0       18.30704 #>  #> $`Degree of freedom` #> [1] "Chi2( 10 )" #>  #> $Conclusion #> [1] "Reject" #>  covTest.single(X, diag(1, 4), ball = TRUE) #> $Hypothesis #> [1] "Mauchly's test of sphericity. H0: Sigma = sigma2 * Ip" #>  #> $`Sample Mean` #> Sepal.Length  Sepal.Width Petal.Length  Petal.Width  #>       5.8433       3.0573       3.7580       1.1993  #>  #> $`Sample deviation` #>              Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width #> Sepal.Length   102.168333   -6.322667     189.8730    76.92433 #> Sepal.Width     -6.322667   28.306933     -49.1188   -18.12427 #> Petal.Length   189.873000  -49.118800     464.3254   193.04580 #> Petal.Width     76.924333  -18.124267     193.0458    86.56993 #>  #> $sigma.hat #> [1] 1.135618 #>  #> $Statistics #>         Statistics         Value p.value Critical.Value #> 1 Likelihood Ratio 8.616505e-321      NA             NA #> 2                W  5.400950e-05      NA             NA #> 3             Chi2  1.448568e+03       0       16.91898 #>  #> $`Degree of freedom` #> [1] "Chi2( 9 )" #>  #> $Conclusion #> [1] "Reject" #>  covTest.single(X, diag(2, 4), ball = TRUE) #> $Hypothesis #> [1] NA #>  #> $`Sample Mean` #> Sepal.Length  Sepal.Width Petal.Length  Petal.Width  #>       5.8433       3.0573       3.7580       1.1993  #>  #> $`Sample deviation` #>              Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width #> Sepal.Length   102.168333   -6.322667     189.8730    76.92433 #> Sepal.Width     -6.322667   28.306933     -49.1188   -18.12427 #> Petal.Length   189.873000  -49.118800     464.3254   193.04580 #> Petal.Width     76.924333  -18.124267     193.0458    86.56993 #>  #> $sigma.hat #> [1] 0.5678088 #>  #> $Statistics #>         Statistics         Value p.value Critical.Value #> 1 Likelihood Ratio 8.616505e-321      NA             NA #> 2                W  5.400950e-05      NA             NA #> 3             Chi2  1.448568e+03       0       16.91898 #>  #> $`Degree of freedom` #> [1] "Chi2( 9 )" #>  #> $Conclusion #> [1] "Reject" #>  covTest.single(X, diag(1, 4), full = TRUE) #> Error in covTest.single(X, diag(1, 4), full = TRUE): unused argument (full = TRUE)

title: Test of Independence — indTest.multi
text: Independence tests multivariate normal populations.

title: Test of Independence — indTest.multi
code: indTest.multi(data, subdim = FALSE, alpha = 0.05, detail = TRUE)

title: Test of Independence — indTest.multi
text: data data matrix matrix data frame. subdim dimensions submatrices. default FALSE, means independence components random vector tested. alpha significance level. Default 0.05. detail boolean value. Default TRUE. TRUE, detail test result displayed.

title: Test of Independence — indTest.multi
text: full FALSE, list containing hypothesis, statistics conclusion returned. full TRUE, list containing hypothesis, sample mean, sample deviation, sample deviation submatrix, statistics, modify factor, degree freedom conclusion returned.

title: Test of Independence — indTest.multi
text: Huixuan, Gao. Applied Multivariate Statistical Analysis. Peking University Press, 2005: pp.92-94.

title: Test of Independence — indTest.multi
text: Xifeng Zhang

what: Test of Multiple Mean Vectors — meanTest.multi
title: Test of Multiple Mean Vectors — meanTest.multi
text: Mean vector test multiple multivariate normal totals covariance array equal (multivariate analysis variance). Note function provides two approximations (Bartlett's chi2 Rao's F) compute p-value critical value, gives realized value Wilks Lambda statistic degrees freedom (set full=TRUE see ), want exact test, look Wilks Lambda according realized value statistic degrees freedom statistic quantile table solve manually.

title: Test of Multiple Mean Vectors — meanTest.multi
code: meanTest.multi(X, label, alpha = 0.05, detail = TRUE)

title: Test of Multiple Mean Vectors — meanTest.multi
text: X data matrix matrix data frame. label vector group labels. alpha significance level. Default 0.05. detail boolean value. Default TRUE. TRUE, detail test result displayed.

title: Test of Multiple Mean Vectors — meanTest.multi
text: full FALSE, list containing hypothesis, statistics conclusion returned. full TRUE, list containing hypothesis, sample size, total sample mean, within group mean, total sum squares, within sum squares, sum squares, statistics, degree freedom, p value, critical value conclusion returned.

title: Test of Multiple Mean Vectors — meanTest.multi
text: Huixuan, Gao. Applied Multivariate Statistical Analysis. Peking University Press, 2005: pp.80-83.

title: Test of Multiple Mean Vectors — meanTest.multi
text: Xifeng Zhang

title: Test of Multiple Mean Vectors — meanTest.multi
code: data(iris) chart <- iris[, 1:4] species <- iris[, 5] meanTest.multi(chart, species) #> $Hypothesis #> [1] "H0: mu1 = mu2 = ... = muk, k =  3" #>  #> $`Sample Size` #>     setosa versicolor  virginica  #>         50         50         50  #>  #> $`Total Sample Mean` #> Sepal.Length  Sepal.Width Petal.Length  Petal.Width  #>     5.843333     3.057333     3.758000     1.199333  #>  #> $`Within Group Mean` #> $`Within Group Mean`$setosa #> Sepal.Length  Sepal.Width Petal.Length  Petal.Width  #>        5.006        3.428        1.462        0.246  #>  #> $`Within Group Mean`$versicolor #> Sepal.Length  Sepal.Width Petal.Length  Petal.Width  #>        5.936        2.770        4.260        1.326  #>  #> $`Within Group Mean`$virginica #> Sepal.Length  Sepal.Width Petal.Length  Petal.Width  #>        6.588        2.974        5.552        2.026  #>  #>  #> $`Total Sum of Squares` #>              Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width #> Sepal.Length 76.924333  -18.124267     193.0458    86.56993 #>  #> $`Within Sum of Squares (Total)` #>              Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width #> Sepal.Length      38.9562     13.6300 6.2718      6.1566 #>  #> $`Within Sum of Squares` #> $`Within Sum of Squares`$setosa #>              Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width #> Sepal.Length       6.0882      4.8616       0.8014      0.5062 #> Sepal.Width        4.8616      7.0408       0.5732      0.4556 #> Petal.Length       0.8014      0.5732       1.4778      0.2974 #> Petal.Width        0.5062      0.4556       0.2974      0.5442 #>  #> $`Within Sum of Squares`$versicolor #>              Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width #> Sepal.Length      13.0552       4.174        8.962      2.7332 #> Sepal.Width        4.1740       4.825        4.050      2.0190 #> Petal.Length       8.9620       4.050       10.820      3.5820 #> Petal.Width        2.7332       2.019        3.582      1.9162 #>  #> $`Within Sum of Squares`$virginica #>              Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width #> Sepal.Length      19.8128      4.5944      14.8612      2.4056 #> Sepal.Width        4.5944      5.0962       3.4976      2.3338 #> Petal.Length      14.8612      3.4976      14.9248      2.3924 #> Petal.Width        2.4056      2.3338       2.3924      3.6962 #>  #>  #> $`Between Sum of Squares` #>              Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width #> Sepal.Length     63.21213   -19.95267     165.2484    71.27933 #> Sepal.Width     -19.95267    11.34493     -57.2396 what: Test of Single Mean Vector — meanTest.single
title: Test of Single Mean Vector — meanTest.single
text: Hypothesis testing mean vector single multivariate normal population covariance matrix known unknown. null hypothesis "H0: mu = mu0".

title: Test of Single Mean Vector — meanTest.single
code: meanTest.single(data, mu0, Sigma0 = FALSE, alpha = 0.05, detail = TRUE)

title: Test of Single Mean Vector — meanTest.single
text: data data matrix matrix data frame. mu0 mean vector null hypothesis true. Sigma0 population covariance matrix. Default FALSE means covariance matrix unknown. alpha significance level. Default 0.05. detail boolean value. Default TRUE. TRUE, detail test result displayed.

title: Test of Single Mean Vector — meanTest.single
text: object class "testResult", list following elements: Stat data frame containing statistics, p value critical value. SampMean sample mean. SampA sample deviation. Df degree freedom.

title: Test of Single Mean Vector — meanTest.single
text: Huixuan, Gao. Applied Multivariate Statistical Analysis. Peking University Press, 2005: pp.66-68.

title: Test of Single Mean Vector — meanTest.single
text: Xifeng Zhang

what: Test of Two Mean Vectors — meanTest.two
title: Test of Two Mean Vectors — meanTest.two
text: Hypothesis testing equality mean vectors two multivariate normal populations covariance matrices equal unequal.

title: Test of Two Mean Vectors — meanTest.two
code: meanTest.two(   data1,   data2,   alpha = 0.05,   equal = TRUE,   method = c("None", "Coupled", "Transformed"),   detail = TRUE )

title: Test of Two Mean Vectors — meanTest.two
text: data1 matrix data frame group 1. data2 matrix data frame group 2. alpha significance level. Default 0.05. equal boolean value. Default TRUE. TRUE, covariance matrix equal. FALSE, covariance matrix equal. method string value. Default "None". equal FALSE, must choose method "Coupled" "Transformed". Choose "Coupled" sample size two groups equal. Choose "Transformed" sample size two groups equal. detail boolean value. Default TRUE. TRUE, detail test result displayed.

title: Test of Two Mean Vectors — meanTest.two
text: object class "testResult", list following elements: Return param equal TRUE. Stat data frame containing statistics, p value critical value. SampMean1 sample mean group 1. SampMean2 sample mean group 2. SampA1 sample deviation group 1. SampA2 sample deviation group 2. Df degree freedom. Return param equal FALSE method "Coupled". Stat data frame containing statistics, p value critical value. SampMeanC sample mean coupled data. SampAC sample deviation coupled data. Df degree freedom. dataC coupled data. Return param equal FALSE method "Transformed". Stat data frame containing statistics, p value critical value. SampMeanT sample mean transformed data. SampAT sample deviation transformed data. Df degree freedom. dataT transformed data. Return param equal FALSE method "Transformed".

title: Test of Two Mean Vectors — meanTest.two
text: Huixuan, Gao. Applied Multivariate Statistical Analysis. Peking University Press, 2005: pp.76-80.

title: Test of Two Mean Vectors — meanTest.two
text: Xifeng Zhang

title: Test of Two Mean Vectors — meanTest.two
code: data(iris) X <- iris[1:50, 1:4] Y <- iris[51:100, 1:4]  test1 <- meanTest.two(X, Y) #> H0: mu1 = mu2 when Sigma1 = Sigma2 #> The sample mean of group 1 is: (5.0063.4281.4620.246)' #> The sample deviation of group 1 is: #>              Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width #> Sepal.Length       6.0882      4.8616       0.8014      0.5062 #> Sepal.Width        4.8616      7.0408       0.5732      0.4556 #> Petal.Length       0.8014      0.5732       1.4778      0.2974 #> Petal.Width        0.5062      0.4556       0.2974      0.5442 #>  #> The sample mean of group 2 is: (5.9362.774.261.326)' #> The sample deviation of group 2 is: #>              Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width #> Sepal.Length      13.0552       4.174        8.962      2.7332 #> Sepal.Width        4.1740       4.825        4.050      2.0190 #> Petal.Length       8.9620       4.050       10.820      3.5820 #> Petal.Width        2.7332       2.019        3.582      1.9162 #>  #> The statistics, p value and critical value are: #>                  Value p.value Critical.Value #> Hotelling T2 2580.8385      NA             NA #> F             625.4583       0       2.467494 #>  #> The degree of freedom is: #>                      df #> Hotelling T2 T2( 4 98 ) #> F             F( 4 95 ) #>  #> Conclusion: Reject test2 <- meanTest.two(X, Y, full = TRUE) #> Error in meanTest.two(X, Y, full = TRUE): unused argument (full = TRUE) test3 <- meanTest.two(X, Y, equal = FALSE, method = "Coupled") #> Error in meanTest.two(X, Y, equal = FALSE, method = "Coupled"): object 'X.bar' not found test4 <- meanTest.two(X, Y, equal = FALSE, method = "Transformed") #> Error in meanTest.two(X, Y, equal = FALSE, method = "Transformed"): object 'A' not found  test1$Stat #>                  Value p.value Critical.Value #> Hotelling T2 2580.8385      NA             NA #> F             625.4583       0       2.467494 test1$SampMean1 #> Sepal.Length  Sepal.Width Petal.Length  Petal.Width  #>        5.006        3.428        1.462        0.246  test3$SampMeanC #> Error: object 'test3' not found test4$dataT #> Error: object 'test4' not found
